discussion_comments.comment_body: nit: I would invert the if statements so that we do not get the code so nested. Other than that looks good to me!

nested `if`s make this a bit hard to read, maybe just split this into simpler top-level `switch` statement?

```go
switch {
	case direction == fromService && index == 0: 
                containers = ...
	case index != 0:
                containers = ...
        default:
                containers = ...
	}
```
`direction = from & index = 0` has been addressed by 1st case, so here we have `(from & index > 0) ||Â (to & index > 0)` which can be simplified as `index > 0`

Perhaps split the switch into a `switch direction`, and within each of those (from/to) do the further checks, which could be a nested `switch` if needed.

Combining the check (especially if they're checking on the same variables, such as `index` is sometimes "tricky", and easy to overlook if there's things excluded or "duplicated".

Note that instead of `||` you can also use `case <condition1>, <condition2>, <condition3> ...`, which (I think) is more common.
